HDG.BC.content: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth
HDG.BC.linkedContent: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth

HDG.BC.content: long acquaintance w/ man, no guarantee man is in right position to ask who he is—not to mention find answer that would possess sustaining power to bring essence of man to fulfillment in historical humanity
HDG.BC.linkedContent: long acquaintance w/ man, no guarantee man is in right position to ask who he is—not to mention find answer that would possess sustaining power to bring essence of man to fulfillment in historical humanity

HDG.BT.content: “in taking over Descartes’ ontological position Kant made an essential omission: he failed to provide an ontology of Dasein”: the meaning of the Being of the ‘sum’

HDG.FS.content: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.content: system: 1) syn: together, gathering, power of conjoining 2) tithēmi: to posit (setzen), positing of Being as objectivity [Kant]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.FS.linkedContent: system: 1) syn: together, gathering, power of conjoining 2) tithēmi: to posit (setzen), positing of Being as objectivity [Kant]

HDG.FS.content: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel characterizes finite as fixity, to fix is to posit, posit apart, and thus in opposition > “the position individuates something posited against something else (Die Setzung vereinzelt etwas Gesetztes gegen ein Anderes)” > finitude thus circumscribed by non-determination, nothingness [?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel characterizes finite as fixity, to fix is to posit, posit apart, and thus in opposition > “the position individuates something posited against something else (Die Setzung vereinzelt etwas Gesetztes gegen ein Anderes)” > finitude thus circumscribed by non-determination, nothingness [?]

HDG.FS.content: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)

HDG.FS.content: perception as aisthēsis [?] > “with the Greeks, and precisely in the distinction btwn aisthēsis and noēsis, hell has already begun” > in perception what presences is “bodily (leibhaftig)” [vs. positing, thesis, of representation], chair, flesh
HDG.FS.linkedContent: perception as aisthēsis [?] > “with the Greeks, and precisely in the distinction btwn aisthēsis and noēsis, hell has already begun” > in perception what presences is “bodily (leibhaftig)” [vs. positing, thesis, of representation], chair, flesh

HDG.FS.content: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)

HDG.FS.content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.FS.linkedContent: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

HDG.FS.content: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])

motif.name: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")
motif.title: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")

HDG.FS.linkedContent: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])

HDG.FS.content: Marx (like Feuerbach): “criticism of religion ends w/ teaching that man is the highest being for man” > Heidegger’s Marx interpretation not political, concerned w/ Being in manner it destines itself: w/ Marx, position of most extreme nihilism is reached [what about Nietzsche?] > if man is the highest being for man, Being (as Being) is nothing (nichts) (nihil) anymore for man > to understand Marx politically: make politics a mode of self-production (perfectly consistent w/ Marx’s thought) (Marx’s statement decidedly metaphysical)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marx (like Feuerbach): “criticism of religion ends w/ teaching that man is the highest being for man” > Heidegger’s Marx interpretation not political, concerned w/ Being in manner it destines itself: w/ Marx, position of most extreme nihilism is reached [what about Nietzsche?] > if man is the highest being for man, Being (as Being) is nothing (nichts) (nihil) anymore for man > to understand Marx politically: make politics a mode of self-production (perfectly consistent w/ Marx’s thought) (Marx’s statement decidedly metaphysical)

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.WL.content: what is speaking (Sprechen), the expression of thought, if we think of its origin as the inner activity of spirit (inneren Geistestätigkeit)? > acc. modern thought, labor of spirit (Arbeit des Geistes) is a setting/positing (Setzen) (thesis), spirit conceived as subject, represented w/in subject-object model (Schema), so positing must be synthesis btwn subject/object

HDG.EC.content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.EC.linkedContent: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

HDG.OHF.content: [Dilthey continues Schleiermacher’s reduction] the developments of hermeneutics (Patristic period and Luther) hidden from Dilthey > still, watering-down of Dilthey today can’t come close to his position re: hermeneutics
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Dilthey continues Schleiermacher’s reduction] the developments of hermeneutics (Patristic period and Luther) hidden from Dilthey > still, watering-down of Dilthey today can’t come close to his position re: hermeneutics

HDG.OHF.content: Dasein as the Unterwegs (being-on-the-way) of itself to itself [esoteric/exoteric] > revealed in this kind of being belonging to hermeneutics: the anticipatory leap forward and running in advance (Vorsprung) can/should be undertaken [de facto, de jure] > Vorsprung doesn’t posit (setzen) an end, but gives it free play (freigeben), puts on the way, discloses, holding fast to being-possible
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Dasein as the Unterwegs (being-on-the-way) of itself to itself [esoteric/exoteric] > revealed in this kind of being belonging to hermeneutics: the anticipatory leap forward and running in advance (Vorsprung) can/should be undertaken [de facto, de jure] > Vorsprung doesn’t posit (setzen) an end, but gives it free play (freigeben), puts on the way, discloses, holding fast to being-possible

HDG.OHF.content: having been addressed as man, the beings-which-are-there (Daisenende) are placed in definite categorial stamps, e.g. “animal rationale” prescribes (verschreibt) definite position for looking (bestimmten Blickstellung) [oblivion of historicity]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: having been addressed as man, the beings-which-are-there (Daisenende) are placed in definite categorial stamps, e.g. “animal rationale” prescribes (verschreibt) definite position for looking (bestimmten Blickstellung) [oblivion of historicity]

HDG.OHF.content: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

HDG.OHF.content: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time

HDG.OHF.content: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
